alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 4:57AM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, with visibility less than a half mile at times. * WHERE...Western Highland County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on icy road conditions due to snow cover and wet surfaces rapidly freezing. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree and power line damage. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Wind Chill Warning, the highest wind speeds will be through this evening. Near blizzard conditions are possible. Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
